SEARCH
Package librarySE.managers.reports

Class ReportExporter

java.lang.Object
librarySE.managers.reports.ReportExporter
public class ReportExporter extends Object
Responsible for exporting library fine-related reports into text or CSV formats.

This class works in collaboration with FineReportService to retrieve fine data per user and media type, and then formats it into human-readable reports.

Supported output types:

  • CSV string format (in-memory) via generateFinesReport(LocalDate)
  • Physical CSV file export via exportFinesReportToCsv(LocalDate)

Reports are automatically saved under the directory: library_data/reports/

Example Output:

 User,Total Fines,Book,CD,Journal
 Alice,12.50,10.00,2.50,0.00
 Bob,0.00,0.00,0.00,0.00
Author:
Eman

  • Constructor Details

    • ReportExporter

      public ReportExporter(FineReportService fineReportService)
      Constructs a new ReportExporter linked to the given FineReportService.
      Parameters:
      fineReportService - the reporting service that provides fine summaries
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if fineReportService is null

  • Method Details

    • generateFinesReport

      public String generateFinesReport(LocalDate date)
      Generates a fines report as a CSV-formatted string.

      The report includes:

      • Username
      • Total fines
      • Breakdown by material type (Book, CD, Journal)

      Parameters:
      date - the reference date for calculating fines
      Returns:
      a CSV text representation of the fines report
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if date is null

    • exportFinesReportToCsv

      public void exportFinesReportToCsv(LocalDate date)
      Exports the fines report to a physical CSV file inside the reports directory.

      The file name format is: fines_YYYY-MM-DD.csv and it is automatically created inside library_data/reports/.

      If the directory does not exist, it will be created automatically.

      Parameters:
      date - the reference date for the report
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if date is null
      RuntimeException - if file creation or writing fails
